meanings.sent1: The acridity of the lemon made my face scrunch up.
meanings.sent2: The acridity of the vinegar stung my nostrils.
meanings.sent3: The acridity of the joke left everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: The acridity of her words cut through the tension in the room.

meanings.definition: A sharp or biting taste or smell.
meanings.sent1: The soup's acridity caught me by surprise.
meanings.sent2: The acridity of the smoke made my eyes water.
meanings.sent3: The acridity of the perfume made me sneeze.
meanings.sent4: The acridity of the coffee woke me up instantly.
meanings.sent5: The acridity of the onion made me tear up.

meanings.definition: Harshness or bitterness in tone or manner.
meanings.sent1: Her acridity towards him was evident in her sharp words.
meanings.sent2: The acridity in his voice made me flinch.
meanings.sent3: Despite the acridity in her tone, she meant well.
meanings.sent4: The acridity of his criticism left me feeling dejected.
meanings.sent5: The acridity of the argument hung heavy in the air.
